title: Digital Game-Based Computer Science Education: Beginner's Course Utilizing Matching Games

context.prior_knowledge: No foundational knowledge in computer science
context.additional_context: Learners use personal devices (tablets/laptops) in a BYOD approach, combining real-time video lectures with game-based activities

learning_goals: Explain basic algorithm concepts with 80% accuracy through ARCS model-based matching games
Achieve over 70% success rates by applying conditional statements/loop concepts in in-game problem-solving processes
Learners demonstrate a 20% or greater improvement in learning motivation scores, as measured by the MSLQ survey, compared to traditional face-to-face instruction.

resources: MSLQ (Motivated Strategies for Learning Questionnaire) Survey Tool

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
